== Main Inclusion Report for libgettext-ruby ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libg/libgettext-ruby]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Enables Ruby applications to i18n via the standard gettext system
** Dependency of kubuntu-firefox-installer (pending MIR)
0. ''Security:''
** No known CVE entries
** No known Secunia history
** No rooted binaries or daemons
** No network activity whatsoever
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data
** No known source code reviews available
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Should always work out of the box
** No debconf questions asked
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:libgettext-ruby|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/libg/libgettext-ruby.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://www.yotabanana.com/hiki/ruby-gettext.html|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** <nowiki>[[http://rubyforge.org/tracker/?atid=3377&group_id=855&func=browse|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with hardware
** Upstream test suite available, not run at build time
0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are internationalized using standard gettext system
** Package doesn't build a PO template during package build (already available from upstream)
0. ''Standards compliance:''
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance
** Packaging system cdbs
** Patch system dpatch
0. ''Dependencies:''
** ruby1.8 (>= 1.8.2), ruby1.8-dev, racc (>= 1.4.3), libracc-runtime-ruby1.8 | libruby1.8 (>= 1.4.3), rake, irb1.8
** libracc-runtime-ruby1.8 - provided by libruby1.8
** irb1.8 - needs to be moved to main
** racc - pending MIR
** rake - pending MIR
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Largely takes care of itself (or rather Debian does)
** The debian maintainer is watching over the quality of this package
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file
** Upstream calls this software ruby-gettext
0. ''Internationalization:''
** non-graphical app
